description: A sower went out to sow, and seed fell on different types of ground.
revelation: The Word of God is received differently by different hearts.

description: An enemy sowed weeds among the wheat while the men slept.
revelation: The coexistence of the righteous and wicked until the final judgment.

description: A tiny seed grows into a large tree where birds nest.
revelation: The Kingdom of God starts small but grows immensely.

description: A woman hid leaven in meal until the whole was leavened.
revelation: The pervasive, transforming power of the Kingdom.

description: A man found treasure in a field and sold all he had to buy it.
revelation: The Kingdom of Heaven is worth sacrificing everything for.

description: A merchant sold all his pearls for one of great value.
revelation: The immeasurable value of finding Christ.

description: A net caught fish of every kind, which were then sorted.
revelation: The final separation of the righteous and the wicked.

description: A shepherd leaves 99 sheep to find the one that is lost.
revelation: God's immense joy over one sinner who repents.

description: A woman sweeps her house to find one lost coin.
revelation: The diligence of God in seeking the lost.

description: A son squanders his inheritance but opens his father's forgiving arms.
revelation: The overwhelming grace and forgiveness of the Father.

description: A despised Samaritan helps a wounded man when religious leaders walk by.
revelation: Love your neighbor, regardless of their background.

description: A servant forgiven a huge debt refuses to forgive a small one.
revelation: We must forgive others as God has forgiven us.

description: Workers hired at the eleventh hour get the same pay as day-long workers.
revelation: God's grace varies not by our merit but by His generosity.

description: One son said he wouldn't go but did; the other said he would but didn't.
revelation: Obedience is better than empty promises.

description: Tenants killed the vineyard owner's servants and son.
revelation: The rejection of the prophets and the Son of God.

description: Guests refused a wedding invitation, so the poor were invited.
revelation: Many are called, but few are chosen.

description: Five wise virgins brought oil, five foolish ones did not.
revelation: Be watchful and ready for the Lord's return.

description: Servants were given talents; clear profit was expected.
revelation: Faithfulness in using the gifts God gives us.

description: The King separates nations based on how they treated the least of these.
revelation: True faith is evidenced by love in action.

description: Seed grows secretly, man knows not how.
revelation: The Kingdom's growth is determined by God's power, not man's.

description: Two debtors were forgiven different amounts; who loves more?
revelation: He who is forgiven much, loves much.

description: A rich man built bigger barns but died that night.
revelation: Life does not consist in the abundance of possessions.

description: Servants must watch for their master's return from the wedding.
revelation: Always be ready for the Son of Man's coming.

description: A tree bore no fruit but was given one more year.
revelation: God's patience allows time for repentance.

description: Original guests made excuses, so the crippled and blind were invited.
revelation: Do not let worldly concerns keep you from God's table.

description: The older brother resented the celebration for the prodigal.
revelation: Self-righteousness can blind us to the Father's heart.

description: A manager reduced debts to make friends before being fired.
revelation: Use worldly wealth to gain eternal friends.

description: A rich man ignored Lazarus; their fates were reversed in death.
revelation: Decisions in this life determine our eternal destiny.

description: A widow kept asking a judge for justice until he granted it.
revelation: Men ought always to pray, and not to faint.

parable: The Pharisee and the Tax Collector
description: One boasted of his works, the other begged for mercy.
revelation: Everyone who exalts himself will be humbled.

description: Servants invested money while their master was away to be king.
revelation: We must be faithful stewards until Jesus returns.

description: Jesus describes himself as the bread that came down from heaven.
revelation: Christ is the necessary sustenance for eternal life.

description: Jesus is the light; whoever follows walks not in darkness.
revelation: Christ illuminates the path to God.

description: The shepherd lays down his life for the sheep.
revelation: Jesus' sacrificial love and protection for His people.

description: Branches must abide in the vine to bear fruit.
revelation: Apart from Christ, we can do nothing.

description: Jesus is the door to the sheepfold.
revelation: Salvation comes only through Christ.

description: One built on rock, the other on sand; only one stood the storm.
revelation: Hear the Word and do it to be secure.

parable: The New Cloth on Old Garment
description: New cloth shrinks and tears the old garment.
revelation: The New Covenant cannot simply be patched onto the Old.

description: New wine bursts old skins.
revelation: New life in the Spirit requires a new heart.

description: A lamp is lit to give light, not to be hidden.
revelation: Let your light shine before men.

description: Judge not the speck in a brother's eye with a log in yours.
revelation: Deal with your own sin before judging others.

description: A good tree cannot bear bad fruit.
revelation: You will know them by their fruits.

parable: The Return of the Unclean Spirit
description: A spirit returns to a clean but empty house with seven others.
revelation: Reformation without transformation is dangerous.

description: As Jonah was in the whale, so the Son of Man in the earth.
revelation: The resurrection is the ultimate sign.

description: One can only plunder a house if the strong man is bound.
revelation: Jesus binds Satan to rescue his people.

description: We played the flute, and you did not dance.
revelation: This generation is unresponsive to God's approaches.

description: If the blind lead the blind, both fall into a pit.
revelation: Be careful who you follow.

description: Wide is the gate to destruction, narrow is the way to life.
revelation: The path of discipleship is difficult but rewarding.

description: Who builds a tower without counting the cost?
revelation: Following Jesus requires total commitment.

description: A king considers if he can win the battle before going to war.
revelation: Consider the cost of following Christ.

description: A servant does not get thanked for doing his duty.
revelation: We are unworthy servants doing only our duty.

description: If the owner knew when the thief was coming, he would watch.
revelation: Be always ready for the Lord's return.

description: Who is the faithful manager the master will put in charge?
revelation: Blessed is the servant found doing his master's will.

parable: The Fig Tree (Signs of the Times)
description: When the branch is tender, summer is near.
revelation: Recognize the signs of the Kingdom's approach.

description: The doorkeeper must stay awake for the master's return.
revelation: Watch and pray.

description: Take the lowest seat at the feast to be exalted.
revelation: Humility leads to honor.

description: A friend knocks at midnight for bread.
revelation: God answers importunate prayer.

description: If salt loses its flavor, it is good for nothing.
revelation: Maintain your distinct kingdom influence.

description: A city set on a hill cannot be hidden.
revelation: The church is the visible presence of God's Kingdom.

description: The vineyard produced wild grapes instead of good ones.
revelation: God judges those who produce no fruit despite His care.
